title: Building Puja Kerang Ajaib
summary: A conversation about building a Magic Conch shell web app inspired by SpongeBob SquarePants.

messages.content: Where can I store audio file in this project?
Recommended storing audio files in public/audio/ for static files served at root path, or src/assets/audio/ for imported files in components.
This is a blank React + TypeScript + Vite starter project. The name 'Puja Kerang Ajaib' is Indonesian, meaning 'Magic Conch Prayer' - possibly a reference to SpongeBob's magic conch shell.
I want to build a single page website with an image of magic conch in the middle. When a user clicks on it, it will generate random answer 'Yes', 'No', 'Maybe', and 'Ask again'
Built the Magic Conch app with: clickable conch image in center, shake animation on click, random answer display after 500ms, and hover effects.
Added background image to body with cover sizing, centered positioning, and fixed attachment. Removed default background colors.
Now the text is unreadable. Please fix it
Added semi-transparent dark overlay with blur effect on the container, white text with shadows for the title and subtitle, and lighter purple for the answer text.
Make it play sound from /public/audio based on the answer
Added audio playback that plays corresponding sound files (iya.mp3, tidak.mp3, etc.) when each answer is shown.
Initialized git repo, created initial commit, installed GitHub CLI, authenticated, and pushed to github.com/anthonykusuma/pujakerangajaib
Export our conversation into JSON file and show it in a page /claude
Created this conversation.json file and a /claude page to display the conversation history.
